bugs.creator: Zuzana Krejčová
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Import from BPMN2 in the Designer does not overwrite the existing process definition. 

Consequence: User had to manually remove the old definition before importing the new one. 

Fix: Designer was modified so that it now prompts the user if the imported definition should replace the existing definition or not.

Result: This issue has been fixed with the latest release. The user can now choose to either replace the old definition or add the imported definition to the already existing one.
bugs.summary: Import from BPMN2 in the Designer does not overwrite

bugs.creator: Rick Wagner
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: REST in BPM doesn't facilitate to search process instances for arbitrary process variables or even retrieve image data.

Consequence: Arbitrary process variables or BAM data can not be accessed or monitored as desired.

Fix: ProcessInstanceLog, NodeInstanceLog and VariableInstanceLog are now implemented in the REST api for BPMS.

Result: The REST API just mirrors the behaviour of the ksession. The general queries about which process instances are active and what their state is goes to the history log that has all the information about the active process instances. In a  way the user gets the information needed in one invocation by using the history log and without impacting the runtime performance.
bugs.summary: Please allow REST access to BAM data (PRODMGT-336)

bugs.creator: Martin Weiler
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: In BRMS 5, the process id had to be manually changed to create a new version of a process to validate the version attribute.

Consequence: When a process is created, the version id of that process is not validated and needs to be automated.

Fix: With the new Mavenized build and deploy approach, the support for versioning has improved significantly.

Result: Process versioning is now automatically validated every time a process is updated or created.
bugs.summary: Improve support for process versioning

bugs.summary: jbpm Console deployment error about ”ERROR [org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaExport]“

Consequence: Failure while trying to use the KPI's name.

Fix: Add empty value check control.

Result: Empty input value is rejected.
bugs.summary: Setting empty string for "KPI's name:" in KPI panel configuration causes NPE

bugs.creator: Jan Hrcek
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: "Show/Hide X labels" feature not implemented for the NVD3 renderer.

Consequence: Show/Hide checkbox not working.

Fix: Implement such feature.

Result: Feature working for both OFC2 and NVD3.

Consequence: No weld-servlet*.jar is found in EAP6.1

Fix: kie-ide.war is used for all the consoles instead of jbpm-designer.war

The url for the dashbuilder application link was incorrect.

Consequence: 

The new opened browser page is not available.

Result: 

Changed url link.

bugs.summary: Process designer in BRM (Guvnor) ignores or removes end-of-lines in code editing (scripttasks, gateways, etc)

bugs.creator: Eric D. Schabell
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Port conflict while running JON v3.1 on the same system on which the BRMS server is deployed.

Consequence: There is a port conflict as the rhq.server.startup.unifiedinvoker.port for JON is set on 5446 and is used as default by hornetq of EAP5.

Fix: Port changed to 5153 for both jbpm code base and eclipse plugin. Change was merged into master and 5.2.x (jbpm), master and 5.3.x (droolsjbpm-tools).

Result: The port conflict issue has been solved for BRMS 5.3 and BPMS6 as both will use a local task service by default.
bugs.summary: BRMS AsyncWSHumanTaskHandler port conflicts with JON port configuration

bugs.creator: Eric D. Schabell
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: The menu items "Save", "Save and close" in Guvnor does not save the existing or new process 

Consequence: Unable to save any changes made in a particular process.

Fix: Downloading and configuring the latest designer for BRMS 5.3 EA2 and clearing the cache can resolve this issue. 

Result: The process can be saved using the "Save", "Save and close" menu items but it does not pop-up with a comment box for a submit message. This is out of date and no longer applicable.
bugs.summary: Guvnor cannot save processes

bugs.creator: Toshiya Kobayashi
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Multiple ksession can not be configured in business-central-server (REST API).

Consequence: Unable to configure multiple ksessions.

Fix: Session manager is now used to support different session strategies (singleton, session per request, session per process instance).

Result: Multiple ksessions can now be configured.
bugs.summary: Multiple ksession for REST API

bugs.creator: Eric D. Schabell
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Authorization fails to connect and access the Guvnor repository in BRMS with JBDS 6.

Consequence: Login fails to sync with the Guvnor repository.

Fix: BRMS / BPMS 6.0, no longer uses this Guvnor plugin, but rather uses the existing Git tooling like EGit to do the integration.

Result: Authorization is not required to sync with the GIT repository as it now replaces the Guvnor repository.
bugs.summary: JBDS 6 with tooling fails to authorize for Guvnor repo access

bugs.creator: Ryan Zhang
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Bad quotes usage in some JSP tag parameter values.

Consequence: Compilation errors and exceptions at UI level.

Fix: Scape the JSP tags parameters properly.

Result: Errors fixed
bugs.summary: Attribute value "region_tab_" + ((Panel)panel).getPanelId() is quoted with " which must be escaped when used within the value

bugs.creator: Ryan Zhang
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Login mechanism badly implemented or incomplete.

Consequence: Login failures not handled properly.

Fix: Implement the login page properly. 

Result: Login/Logout/SSO working fine.
bugs.summary: HTTP Status 404 - /dashbuilder/j_security_check --Dashboard console log in issue

bugs.creator: Sona Mala
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Summary: Trying to open a process with no incoming or outgoing element definitions in the Designer will fail without any error messages and the system will hang. 

Cause: Designer for  signal.bpmn process takes an indefinite to load.

Consequence: The loader is displayed without loading the process or showing an alert if the file is corrupted.

Fix: Nodes in the signal.bpmn process do not have incoming/outgoing element definitions. Designer needs them to assemble connections between the nodes.

Result: Defining the incoming/outgoing elements in the signal.bpmn process can load it instantly in the designer.
bugs.summary: Loading designer for signal.bpmn never end - probably invalid definition

bugs.creator: Sona Mala
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Rearranging the position of any tab using the "Drag to rearrange a tab using compass" feature makes the designer screen disappear.

Consequence: Unable to edit or work on the process which is open as the designer disappears. 

Fix: The designer reloads after the tabs are rearranged without disappearing or displaying an empty space.

Result: Rearranging a tab reloads the designer showing the process and any changes made remain unchanged.
bugs.summary: Rearrange position of any tab caused that designer disappears

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Deploying both business-central and dashbuilder in parallel gives an error - javax.persistence.PersistenceException: [PersistenceUnit: org.jbpm.domain] Unable to build EntityManagerFactory

Consequence:  Fails to start the server.

Fix: Dash-builder is now upgraded to hibernate4 so that it can be deployed in parallel with business-central as per the installation procedure.

Result: Both, busines-central.war and dashbuilder.war can now be deployed simultaneously without giving any errors.
bugs.summary: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: [PersistenceUnit: org.jbpm.domain] Unable to build EntityManagerFactory

Consequence: The set of visible icons is changed, but there is no option to show the previous set of icons.

Fix: This has been fixed in the latest release and the button is visible now.

Result: In ER4, when Next button is present then Previous button is also visible.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Summary: In a Designer canvas window, if the user has a process open, the buttons to decrease the size of the canvas in the top and left sides of the screen never show up. The buttons to decrease the size of the canvas in the bottom and right sides do show up.

Cause: The decrease canvas size button in the Business Process Modelling screen is never shown up.

Consequence: The canvas size can be increased but can not be decreased.

Fix: Both the button are visible on hovering the mouse over them.

Result: The canvas size can be increased or decreased as required.

Consequence: Tasks assigned to a specific user or a group cannot be viewed.

Fix: "Group" as a menu item is now added to the Task List perspective tool-bar to show the list of tasks assigned to a specific user.

Result: The assigned Group task are now shown in the Tasks view/perspective.

Cause: The Oracle DB CORRELATION_PROPERTY_INFO_ID_SEQ identifier has more than 30 characters defined.

Consequence: Reports an error during the kie-ide deployment, which is logged in the server.log.

Fix: The character size of this identifier is now shortened and within the specific limit of 30 characters, renamed as CORRELATIONPROPERTYINFO.

Result: There is no error logged during the deployment.

Cause: Missing "Delete", "Rename" and "Copy" menu items for BPMN2 asset

Consequence: Unable to perform rename, delete or copy operations for the BPMN2 asset

Fix: The required "Delete", "Rename" and "Copy" menu items are added.

Result: Operations like copy, rename and delete can be performed for BPMN2 asset as required.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Due Date attribute of the human tasks doesn't reflect or show the time set as its deadline.

Consequence: Human tasks have a Due Date attribute holding the deadline date and time. This date and time can be set, but only the date is remembered, time is set to 00:00:00.

Fix: The Due Date attribute is now fixed in a way to show the Time which is set as the deadline for the human task.

Result: The attribute now shows the Date and Time which is set for the human task.
bugs.summary: Due Date of human tasks doesn't reflect the time set

Fix: startProcess and getvariables REST operations now added.

Result: startProcess REST operation returns various information about the process instance while the getvariables REST operations returns with the process instance variables.

Consequence: Oracle and SQL server not supported.

Fix: Fix both the conflictive class and SQL queries

Result: Working in Oracle and SQLServer on EAP 6.1.

Consequence: App did use its own log file based on Log4J.

Fix: Migrate core logging service core to SLF4J 

Result: Now, the app uses an standarized approach for logging. JBoss logging service will be taken by SLF4J.

Cause: PostgreSQL 9.1 was already supported. IBM DB2 9.7 was not supported.

Consequence: Cannot run in IBM DB2 9.7

Result: Deployment working.

Cause: Two providers can be created with identical names without any feedback to the user

Consequence: It becomes difficult to tell those providers apart

Fix: Data provider management has been refactored so that this is now considered to be an error, and will be as such notified to the user

Result: Whenever a user tries to create a new data provider with a name that is already in use (for the same locale), the creation is aborted and an error message is displayed.

Fix: Format the warning message properly.

Result: Message shown to the user.

Fix: Get the cloned dashboard by its persistent identifier and also clone all the KPI referred by the dashboard panels.

Summary: Giving permission to a non-administrative user for an administrative task doesn't enable the Administrator bar. For example, granting a general privilege of "Create workspaces" to the user with "End user" role, should allow him to use this privilege. But the user is unable to do so because the Administration bar is not accessible without granting the "Administrate" privilege for the Showcase workspace.

Cause: User doesn't get the "Administrate" privilege when "Create Workspaces" privilege is granted.

Consequence: User doesn't get to use the Administrator bar as it is not visible to him based on the permissions granted.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Inconsistency in description of the menu item name and tab heading for Task List - Advanced View.

Consequence: This can create a confusion for the users as the menu item is named as "Task List - Grid View" and the tab heading is as "Task list (Advanced View)".

Fix: This is now resolved and both the descriptions are made consistent by naming them as "Task list (Advanced View)"

Result: There is no more inconsistency in the names which can cause any confusion for the users.
bugs.summary: Menu item name "Task List - Grid View"  inconsistent with tab heading "Task list (Advanced View)"

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Summary: Multiple incoming/outgoing sequence flows to/from activities cause the build to fail in the Designer even though the process passes validation. This is caused by the lack of a system property in the Designer. In a future release, a process with multiple flows will fail validation as the validation errors from core engine will be added to the Designer validation process.

Cause: Build a valid BPMN2 process in Designer with multiple flows and from multiple activities. Validate and try to create a build.

Consequence: Validation passes, but the build fails.

Workaround: None at this stage. Expected Fix in ER5.

Result: Designer will not allow the user to build a process with multiple flows from multiple activities.
bugs.summary: Unable to build valid process from designer

Consequence: Users with only the kie-user role can't access the jBPM dashboard.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Wrong link on home page - Business Activity Monitoring

Consequence: The link "Business Activity Monitoring" on the home page of Business Central targets to .../bam-app.

Fix: This has been fixed and the link now targets to Business Activity Monitoring 

Result: Users can now access the Business Activity Monitoring using the link provided on the home page of the business central.
bugs.summary: Wrong link on home page - Business Activity Monitoring

bugs.creator: Sona Mala
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Unable to simulate a process which contains the Exclusive Gateway.

Consequence: Causes a simulation alert "Simulation engine did not return results." and an error java.lang.NullPointerException in the server.log.

Fix: This exception was caused due to the missing condition expressions on sequence flows going out of diverging XOR gateway. Since simulation relies on the jbpm runtime engine, it used a regular validation that ensures all execution related data is present. Although while running simulation there is no need to have a fully executable process and therefore an enhancement was provided to resolve this issue.

Result: No error or exception is given while simulating the process which contains the Exclusive Gateway.
bugs.summary: Unable to simulate process which contains Exclusive Gateway

bugs.creator: Sona Mala
bugs.summary: Icons in Quick Menu for Gateway are not displayed

bugs.creator: Sona Mala
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Missing the validator for Work Item Definition asset.

Consequence: If a user creates an invalid Work Item Definition, then the Designer does not show the validator as a service task in the Shape Repo.

Fix: Validation of assets, including Work Item Definitions, has been added back. All assets are validated when saved (and errors reported in the Problems Panel). 

Result: The user can now validate an asset without saving it by clicking on a new "validate" button on the editor.
bugs.summary: Missing validator for Work Item Definition asset

bugs.creator: Sona Mala
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Unable to export BPMN2 process to PDF file.

Consequence: The browser which populates after clicking on the "Export to pdf" feature cannot find the file which needs to be created in pdf format.

Fix: Both share and download are now functional for png and pdf. Fix was implemented in designer master and 6.0.x branches.

Result: The required BPMN2 process can now be exported to pdf.
bugs.summary: Unable to export BPMN2 process to PDF file

bugs.creator: Sona Mala
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: Unable to export BPMN2 process to PNG file.

Consequence: The browser which populates after clicking on the "Export to png" feature cannot find the file which needs to be created in pdf format.

Fix: Both share and download are now functional for png and pdf. Fix was implemented in designer master and 6.0.x branches.

Result: The required BPMN2 process can now be exported to PNG file.
bugs.summary: Unable to export BPMN2 process to PNG file

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Summary: Due to duplicate AJAX calls, the requests submitted from FormModeler page anchors when a user clicks on a menu item is erroneously sent twice. This results in the Header Panel being hidden. This behavior only occurs in Google Chrome browser. Use an alternate browser till a fix is available.

Cause: The request's submitted from form modeler page anchors were duplicated, request was sent twice.

Consequence: Header panel for form modeler screen was hidden.

Fix: Send only one single ajax request on form modeler page anchors.

Result: Header panel for form modeler is always visible.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Summary: Due to an underlying synchronization issue, deploying Dashbuilder to an EAP domain with more than one node causes a deadlock when all the nodes try to execute the initial modules DML sentences at the same time. The Dashbuilder gets deployed, but the node with the failure doesn't start and the user cannot login.

Cause: All nodes were trying execute initial modules DML sentences at same time.

Consequence: Operation failed and node did not startup.

Fix: Syncronize initial modules DML sentences using a database table. 

Result: Only one node executes initial modules DML sentences.
bugs.summary: Deadlock in DB when deploying dashbuilder to EAP domain with multiple nodes

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Summary: Creating a group name that is the same as a role name will cause that group to be inaccessible for task assignments for Human tasks. At the moment, there are only two roles: analyst and admin, and group names should not be same as these. In a future release, role names will be expanded to include developer, user and manager and you should avoid using these as group names as well.

When you want to have a human task, that you want to be assigned to users based on their membership in some group, you need to avoid group names: analyst, developer

Cause:

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Fixed Issue Summary:

The system used to throw an IllegalArgumentException when a kjar with missing dependencies was uploaded. This message was not very clear about the actual error and it was often misleading. The system now informs the user with a more helpful error message when a kjar with missing dependencies is uploaded.
				

Known Issue Summary:

The system throws an IllegalArgumentException when a kjar with missing dependencies is uploaded. This message is not clear about the actual error and is misleading. The system should instead let the user know that the kjar that they have just uploaded is missing some dependencies.
bugs.summary: Inform a user that a kjar cannot be uploaded due to missing dependencies instead of throwing IllegalArgumentException: number of transferred bytes cannot be negative

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 
SSO does not work properly with distributable application on EAP 6.1.1 in the default configuration. However, it can be configured to work in EAP cluster.

Consequence: 
<distributable/> tag has been commented out in EAP6 deployable binaries, which makes clustering of web session unavailable by default. 

Workaround (if any): 
To enable both SSO and distributable application feature, SSO must be configured to use proper cache container with replicated cache.

Result:
bugs.summary: <distributable/> tag is commented out in web.xml

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 

Consequence: 
User cannot add a boundary event to an ad-hoc subprocess.

Workaround (if any): 
An embedded subprocess can be used instead of an ad-hoc subprocess to simulate the expected behaviour.

Result: 
If a user tries to add a boundary event to an ad-hoc subprocess the event is added as an intermediate event inside the subprocess.
bugs.summary: Cannot attach boundary event to Ad-Hoc Subprocess

bugs.cf_release_notes:
When you run a simulation, the Simulation engine does not mark elements which run in event subprocess. This state is displayed by the path results and the Simulation results for such elements exist in the tree of graphs. A user is likely to assume that the elements in event subprocess were ignored by simulation engine when they have actually been run.

Cause:
Simulation engine does not mark elements which run in event subprocess. This state is displayed by Path results. Simulation results for such elements exist in the tree of graphs.

Consequence: 
An user may think that elements in event subprocess were ignored by simulation engine.

Workaround (if any): 

Result:
bugs.summary: Simulation results: Nodes in event subprocess are not marked as visited

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 

Consequence: 
If sum of probabilities for XOR is smaller than 100% then simulation engine executes "sum of probabilities" * "number of required instances" / 100 instances of process.

Workaround (if any):
no workaround

Result:
Unexpected simulation's result.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Switching too early from the Authoring perspective to another perspective (for example, the Developer perspective) after clicking on Build & Deploy causes invalid behavior. This issue happens specifically if you swtich before the message displaying the  result of the Build & Deploy has disappeared. Changes made during the session may or may not be saved. To get around this issue, make sure to wait for the message to completely disappear before switching perspectives.

Cause: 

Consequence: 
The information about the deployed project/deployment unit, displayed throughout the BPMS perspectives, is incorrect if the user changes the relevant information and leaves the Authoring perspective too soon after clicking Build & Deploy.

Workaround (if any): 
Wait for the 'Build successful' notification to disappear before leaving the Authoring perspective or build the project again.

Result:
bugs.summary: Bad deployment unit information if user leaves Authoring too soon

When saving a Business Process in the jBPM Designer, the underlying Git commit is done as user 'admin', even if there is no such user.

Consequence: 
When dealing with conflicts, the error pop-up says: 'User admin has updated the following resource ...' no matter which user actually made the change and saved.

Workaround (if any): 
None.

Result: 
There is no way to determine which user made which change on a Business Process through the jBPM Designer.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Latest summary:

REST operations that retrieved Task instances would fail when forced to use the JSON format (ACCEPT header). There was a server side error thrown when the server instance tried to convert the (JAXB) Task instance to JSON. The workaround for this issue was to use XML instead of JSON (by setting it in the ACCEPT header).
This issue has now been fixed in the latest version of the product and the workaround is no longer required.

Old Summary:

REST operations that retrieve Task instances will fail when forced to use the JSON format (ACCEPT header). There is a server side error thrown when the server instance tries to convert the (JAXB) Task instance to JSON. To workaround this issue, please use XML instead of JSON (by setting it i the ACCEPT header).


Cause: 

Consequence: 

Fix: 

Result:
bugs.summary: Unable to retrieve a JSON formatted Task instance via the REST API

bugs.cf_release_notes:
The Process Designer was unable to open processes containing user tasks that had been written externally if they contained missing data types. While trying to open such processes, an exception was thrown and nothing was displayed. The runtime for BPMS could execute these processes, but the Process Designer GUI had trouble displaying them. In addition, a process that contained "." in process variable names also caused issues when they were displayed in the Process Designer.
Both these issues have now been fixed with this release.
bugs.summary: Process can not be reopened in Designer if it is imported containing missing data types

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Process changes were not being reflected when a project was re-deployed with the same GAV (Group, Artifact and Version) and the same BPMN version. The only known workaround was to change any of the GAV for that project.
This issue has now been fixed by ensuring that on undeploy of runtime manager the releaseId of the project was removed from the local KIE repo. The repo used to keep a local cache of deployed artifacts and this was causing the older version of the project to be used on runtime.
bugs.summary: Process changes are not reflected after redeploying unit with same GAV and process version

bugs.creator: Anton Giertli
bugs.cf_release_notes:
The two options available for loading property files in the LDAPUserGroupCallbackIml were not functional and buggy.
The files were not loaded when their location was specified by a system property and neither were they loaded when they were dropped under business-central.war/WEB-INF/classes folder. The only workaround was to add the property files directly in the org.jbpm module.
This has now been fixed by allowing any valid URL to specify location of the UserGroupCallback property file. In addition to URL protocols (file, http, etc) you can now use classpath. If no protocol is available (no valid URL) the classpath based location is assumed. From classpath the system will try to load first from local class loader (class that requires the reading) and if not found fall back to thread context class loader.
bugs.summary: Properties file can't be load in LDAPUserGroupCallbackImpl

Fixed Issue Summary:

A bug with handling maven dependencies in kie-ci occurred in which only direct dependencies of the project were taken, but the transitive dependencies were not. This would result in the following error:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/springframework/context/ApplicationContext
This issue has been resolved with 6.0.3, and the script runs without errors.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Fixed Issue Summary:

A process definition error occurred when updating multiple instance subprocesses because the multiple instance outputs needed to be defined; however, Designer did not provide the ability to define output variables for multiple instance subprocesses. Accordingly, whenever the processes were completed, the updated values were lost and reverted back to the original values. This has been fixed by allowing the definition of multiple instance outputs.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 

Only in IE9 seems that when using innerHTML method, it evaluates the scripts found in the html code to insert, this behavior not happens in other IE versions (8, 10,11) neither Chrome/Safari.

So all the script tags inserted in the ajax refreshed portlet, in IE9, are executed twice: once when using innerHTML (attach the http response to a DOM element) and further when adding the new DOM element into the existing DOM tree (appendChild).

Consequence:

Both setAjax and refreshPanel javascript functions were called twice, producing some unexpected errors. 

Fix: 

Control that both setAjax and refreshPanel javascript functions are only executed once per ajax request.

Result: 

As functions are called just once,no unexpected results appear.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 

Only in IE9 seems that when using innerHTML method, it evaluates the scripts found in the html code to insert, this behavior not happens in other IE versions (8, 10,11) neither Chrome/Safari.

So all the script tags inserted in the ajax refreshed portlet, in IE9, are executed twice: once when using innerHTML (attach the http response to a DOM element) and further when adding the new DOM element into the existing DOM tree (appendChild).

Consequence:

Both setAjax and refreshPanel javascript functions were called twice, producing some unexpected errors. 

Fix: 

Control that both setAjax and refreshPanel javascript functions are only executed once per ajax request.

Result: 

As functions are called just once,no unexpected results appear.
